application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Conversion of the existing property into five self-contained residential units (following part demolition of existing outbuilding); provision of car parking, landscaping and refuse
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents: Site Location Plan; A1 received 11.05.2023 (Ground Floor & Basement - Existing); A2 (First & Second Floor - Existing); A3 (Rear & Front Elevations - Existing); A4 (South Side Elevation - Existing); A5 (North Side Elevation - Existing); A6 (Outbuilding - Existing Elevations); A7 (Section A-A' - Existing); A1 (Block, Roof Plan & Parking - Proposed); A2 (Ground Floor - Proposed); A3 (First & Second Floor - Proposed); A4 (South Elevation - Proposed); A5 (North Elevation - Proposed); A6 (Rear & Front Elevations - Proposed); A7 (Outbuilding - Proposed Elevations) A7 (Section A - Proposed).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall match those described in the approved drawings and documents listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the special character of the Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and the Mount Park Conservation Area Management Plan. | The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall be used only for domestic purposes incidental to the flats on this site, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, letting or any commercial use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to first occupation, 9 covered and secured cycle parking spaces shall be implemented in the location shown on the approved plans and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the adequate cycle storage, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) and 6.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy T5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shall be implemented in accordance with the submitted documentation and Council Policy and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policy SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to first occupation, the amenity spaces, hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatments shall be installed and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policy SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). The sound insulation of the building envelope shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Section 6 Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building).  The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing interim SPG10. | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, kitchen/living/dining/bathroom above/below/adjoining bedroom of separate dwelling. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing interim SPG10. | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
